description: {"blocks":[{"key":"bvca","text":"This protocol is meant to transfer samples from different plates to a single or fewer final plates than the source number, in other words, merge samples of different source plates in a final plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"909fc","text":"The output of running this script will be the final plate(s) with samples and a reactive (optional), and the corresponding map(s) with the original identities of the samples which will be given by the user in the input file.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4v338","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"265a3","text":"This protocol uses a python script for an Opentrons 2 robot and an excel file containing the required variables to set the number of samples, volumes of transfer, type of plates, etc... ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2s9b8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8hdm","text":"In our laboratory, this protocol has been used as part of the \"High-throughput workflow for the genotypic characterization of transposon library variants\" also available in protocols.io","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"evqc2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ao79c","text":"This protocol is a set of instructions or description of the LAP repository entry LAP-NplateMerging-OT2-2.0.0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":82,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":61,"length":14}],"data":{}},{"key":"9bruf","text":"You can find the script and complementary information for this specific version of the protocol in this LAP entry link and GitHub Link to LAP entry documents","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":104,"length":14},{"key":2,"offset":123,"length":34}],"data":{}},{"key":"5mi6o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mm55","text":"The major changes from previous version are:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":44}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"biqpa","text":"Change of name variable API Name Rack 15mL Falcon Reactives which is called now API Name Rack Falcon Reactives","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":60},{"style":"italic","offset":28,"length":31},{"style":"italic","offset":80,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50mdr","text":"The program now accepts falcon tubes and tube racks of 15ml or 50ml. It does not accept mix tube racks.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":68}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"alssg","text":"Description of robot and protocol setup in a separate protocols.io entry (Setting and Customizing OT-2 for LAP Entries)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":72}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15jvj","text":"The page(s) that corresponds to the map(s) set in the variable 'Name Sheet Map Identifiers' of the page PerPlateVariables need to have the column and row names corresponding to the ones of the labware set in the variable 'API Name Source Plate' of the sheet GeneralVariables","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":63,"length":28},{"style":"bold","offset":122,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"42989504FF9447C9B1B2CCC1C796D3C6","url":"http://www.laprepo.com"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5C9767C6545C4BC2940DF9DAB248438C","url":"https://www.laprepo.com/protocol/colony-n-plates-merging-v-2-0-0/"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CC659E58A94D4361A649A27303B1CBAB","url":"https://github.com/BiocomputationLab/LAPrepository/tree/main/LAPEntries/LAP-NplateMerging-OT2-2.0.0"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"4plq8","text":"This protocol was developed with python 3.7.1, OT App Software Version 7.0.2 and API level version 2.14 in a Linux 4.14.74 system (these are the OT-2 specifications).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46d70","text":"In the script several packages are used:  pandas (0.25.3), openpyxl (3.1.2), math, random and numpy (1.15.1)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eion9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ce1m0","text":"It has been tested with cultures from Pseudomonas putida KT2440 as part of the High-throughput workflow for the genotypic characterization of transposon library variants.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":38,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42qhp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b9d91","text":"The maximum number of 96-well plates per run is 8 source plates to 1 final plates dispensing some media (need of 1 falcon tube rack), 1 pipette is required for all the volumes and the replace of tip racks is allowed (set as True in the input variable file)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
